quotes: Qian is careful in describing his relations with Warren Christopher, as the principal incident he discusses, in chapter 9, concerns then –Taiwan president Lee Teng -hui’s visit to Cornell University in 1995.
Qian does not mention Christopher’s disastrous trip to Beijing in March 1994, when he was treated every bit as rudely as Baker had been in 1991.
Qian describes his April 17, 1995, meeting with Christopher at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel in New York in brief terms.
That visa was issued on May 22, 1995, precipitating a serious crisis in U.S. -China relations, which Qian describes in detail.

quotes: I had also warned him that overwhelming congressional support for the Lee visit (reflected by the 97 -1 and 360 -0 votes in the Senate and House on resolutions endorsing the visit) could not be ignored.

roles.title: foreign minister
quotes: When the foreign minister of a superpower makes a promise externally, then unexpectedly goes back on his word, that cannot help but cause people to feel shock and indignation.
Qian does not mention Christopher’s disastrous trip to Beijing in March 1994, when he was treated every bit as rudely as Baker had been in 1991.
Qian describes his April 17, 1995, meeting with Christopher at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel in New York in brief terms.

When we spoke about Lee Teng -hui’s scheme to visit the United States, Christopher pledged clearly that the United States would not permit Lee to visit America, and said that a Lee visit to America was not consistent with the unofficial character of America’s relations with Taiwan;
